isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Timing Gear Train and Front Cover - Remove - Front Cover (Front Half) Assembly

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral or park, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle.

step1.para: Install breaker bar in belt tensioner and remove tension on belt.
Remove serpentine belt.
Slowly release breaker bar and return belt tensioner to original position. Remove breaker bar.
Loosen mounting bolt and remove belt tensioner.
Remove alternator.
Loosen and remove alternator mounting bracket bolts.
Remove bracket.
Remove fan pulley bolts. Remove pulley. Use Special Pulley "C" Wrench to hold pulley during fastener removal.
Remove fan hub drive cap screws and hub.

note.para: Engines may be equipped with either an optional air compressor or power steering pump or both.

step1.para: Loosen and remove two steering pump bolts from air compressor.
Loosen two coolant hose clamps connecting coolant hoses to air compressor and crankcase and remove coolant hoses.
Loosen and remove two oil lubrication line nuts from air compressor. Remove oil line.
Remove two air compressor bracket mounting bolts from air compressor.

figure.caption: Remove air compressor bracket mounting bolts

step1.para: Remove two air compressor bracket mounting bolts from crankcase. Remove bracket.
Remove two air compressor mounting bolts from front cover. Remove air compressor.
Remove engine front mounting bracket and vibration damper. See " Vibration Damper Assembly " in the "Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase" section in this manual.
Remove lubricating oil pump. See " Remove Lubricating Oil Pump " in the "Lubricating Oil Pump, Oil Filter, and Cooler" section of this manual.
Loosen and remove front cover mounting bolts from rear half of front cover and crankcase.
Remove front half of front cover (with hardware) from rear half of front cover and set aside.
Remove and discard gaskets, seals, and O-rings from front cover.

figure.caption: Front cover O-rings, seals, and gaskets

note.para: Oil pressure relief valve (stamped with "fc") should be tagged when removed to ensure identification. Do not mix oil pressure relief valve with oil pressure regulator valve (found inside crankcase).

step1.para: Depress oil pressure relief valve plunger, trap a length of copper wire under plunger seat, release plunger. Pull the copper wire and oil pressure relief valve from front cover (rear half).
